intro: Peixotoa, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a shrub or small tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy berries that are a food source for various wildlife. Peixotoa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
